CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1951, pg. 32 reads: "Carnegie Tech Graduates - Five Negroes received degrees at ceremonies at Carnegie Institute of Technology last Thursday...J. Frederick Gentry was sole Negro to gain the Master of Fine Arts degree. His major is music.  He sang a leading role in spring production of "The Marriage of Figaro," this year and was featured in other recitals...The Courier wishes the [gradu]ates of Carnegie Tech the best of luck in their [vo]cations."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Carnegie Institute of Technology graduate J. Frederick Gentry, standing with other graduates in Syria Mosque, Oakland
